summary: 25 Days Of Christmas. Day 9: I’ll be home for Christmas. fluff - words 483 .-.-.-. “Harry,” Jeff Bhasker said from the...
caption:
25 Days Of Christmas.

Day 9: I’ll be home for Christmas.

fluff - words 483

.-.-.-.

“Harry,” Jeff Bhasker said from the soundboard table. “Are you listening?”

Shaking his head, Harry turned from his guitar to look up at him. “Sorry what,” his mind was still on you.

Harry had only talked to you this morning, he had seen how sad your eyes were, at least when they were open, he saw it. A few months ago, when he told you he would be in LA recording over Christmas he saw how hurt you were then. That was when he should have decided to home. Your eyes used to twinkle around this time of the year but now they were dull and he wanted so desperately to see the little glint again.

“I said did you like it?” Jeff asked again, messing around with some of the buttons of him while looking at the screen.

“Yeah, it’ great.” Harry said. He hadn’t listened to one note of the edited song. He didn’t really care. The song would be there after Christmas but your happiness wouldn’t be.

Setting his guitar to the side he grabbed his phone, booking the next flight home to you.

.-.-.-.

Carefully Harry pulled the front door closed behind him. The house was quite so he guessed that you were still asleep upstairs and he didn’t want to disturb you just yet. Slowly he started up the stairs, moving slowly over the few steps he knew creaked under his weight.

Pushing the door to the bedroom he smiled upon seeing you. You were tucked under the sheets but he could see your bare shoulder from where it had slipped out from beneath the warmth, the red strap of your camisole hanging loosely over your skin.

Dropping his bags down into the wardrobe he pulled his shirt over his head, pants quickly following so he was only wearing his boxers. He watched you sleep for a short second, you looked peacefully and he was careful not to move the bed to much as he climbed in behind you.

Moving as close as possible to you, he moved a hand over your hip before resting it on top of your belly. You stirred a little at the feeling, your heart rate picking up in fear before you heard his quite voice.

“Just me baby, go back to sleep.” He whispered near your ear, pressing gentle kisses to your neck.

“Harry?” you moaned. “Are you really here?”

“Yes baby,” he chuckled, hand soothing over your belly. “Came home for Christmas to see you.”

“Really,” You whispered, turning over to see him behind you. He looked just as drained as you, eyes drooping.

Running a hand over his cheek you pulled him down towards you, giving him a tired almost sloppy kiss. “I love you so much. I’m so glad you’re back.”

“I don’t ever want to miss a Christmas with you. That smile is way to pretty to miss.”

25 Days Of Christmas.

Day 9: I’ll be home for Christmas.

fluff - words 483

.-.-.-.

“Harry,” Jeff Bhasker said from the soundboard table. “Are you listening?”

blog.name: harry-vodkastraightnogay-styles
blog.description: Treat People with Kindness & Choose Love, Always || Just a blog for my Larry obsession 🦋her/she, 20 ◟̽◞̽

tags: i know my grammar is bad
title: I’ll always miss One Direction
body:
I love and respect the boys more than anything in the world. 

The music they have decided to publish is absolutely amazing and I understand their need for a break after 5 years of very hard work. I couldn’t be more proud of them.

But there won’t go a day where I will not miss them being together. Being One Direction.

Those months where they were on tour and we would have new pictures and videos of them every night from the shows doing what they loved to do and then some. They would tweet random things to us or each other and post lots of pictures. And when the tour was over, we would find it stressful to keep track of everyone. All the awards they or we won for them and their speeches always thanking the fans.
I remember all the funny post people made when new music videos came out and we would try to break the Vevo record for the boys. #refreshnotreplay. I remember when the Best Song Ever music video came out. There were probably a thousand fanfics and imagines written about Marcel Styles and you know you read them. I remember This Is Us being released and how proud we were of the boys for making a movie. Talking about movies, but more so acting. The one Icarly episode that will forever be iconic. And what about 1D Day. They promised us 7 hours of content and boy did we get it. From the interviews to the world records and ninjas, modelling, wrestling and so much more. It was chaotic but we were used to chaos. The Talk Dirty to Me and Workout video that killed us all. Meanwhile, everyone had to pretend that it was the first time we had listen to Midnight Memories. We really did leak everything. And even though some were okay with it and so were not, we still got the boys to the top of the charts and supported them. And they always knew. They were always so thankful and stayed their polite and grounded selves. They made the concerts unique and danced, jumped and fell while eating various things, some thrown on stage. We had our beautiful moments when the boys would let us sing Little Things for them. And when the sound of our voices would sing as loud as we could making sure everyone outside the stadium could hear us clearly. We loved and still love our boys. 

We would be the best to make fun of them and drag them for whatever reason but we would always be there to defend them when others thought they needed to insert themselves. And we always knew we weren’t the most loved fandom but nobody wanted to fuck with us and our boys. We ended somebodies career and we stood up for the boys when the media got too much. But they had out back too. They knew us as we knew them though we still blew them away with our amazing fan projects. They would defend us as we defended them. It was “a teamwork between us and them”. We had an amazing time. We made sure they were on the top of the world always. And we made sure the world also knew by trending whatever we wanted on Twitter, which we by the way ruled.
And they made sure to take care of us when we had the worst day of our life and 5 became 4. They made sure the strong bond was still there and we made sure to still support them through it all. The concerts became more personal as we got water fights and more falling as well as a lot more reading of our crazy signs. We got new music as well as the news of a break. We cried with them as they sang History on X Factor promise us to be back.

So yeah it hurts when people or even the boys say “was in a band” or when people talk about how they broke up. But only because they gave us 5 absolutely amazing eventful years of pure happiness. And we have so many memories together. We get scared that they will forget about those years cause they feel like yesterday but at the same time decades ago to us. We realize that we miss them and what we used to have together. We get scared they didn’t enjoy the ride as much as we did or scared they didn’t enjoy each others company or the music they made. 
It’s all memories that will forever be with us and everyone will have a hard time letting those memories go along with how it all used to be.

So yes I’m proud of each of the boys and what they have achieved on their own. I’ll forever support them and their decision. And even when (or if) they come back I know it will be different somehow. 

And I’ll always miss the good old times of One Direction

blog.description:
"a very enthusiastic keysmash walking around"

Mia, 33, Netherlands.
Writer. Cat lover. Baking enthusiast.

Currently identifying as somewhere
on the asexual and aromantic spectrum

summary: There’s really nothing better      (than a beautiful boy in an ugly Christmas sweater)  Written as...
body:
There’s really nothing better
     (than a beautiful boy in an ugly Christmas sweater)


Written as part of the @larryholidayfest

By we_are_the_same

Moodboard by the wonderful @londonfoginacup

In the weeks leading up to Christmas, Louis takes on a few more shifts at his part time job to be able to buy Christmas presents for his family and friends. In comes Harry, who might be everything Louis had never asked for. Featuring ugly Christmas Sweaters, too many Christmas songs, and not enough snow.

9K, Teen and Up

trail.content_raw:
There’s really nothing better
     (than a beautiful boy in an ugly Christmas sweater)


Written as part of the @larryholidayfest

By we_are_the_same

Moodboard by the wonderful @londonfoginacup

In the weeks leading up to Christmas, Louis takes on a few more shifts at his part time job to be able to buy Christmas presents for his family and friends. In comes Harry, who might be everything Louis had never asked for. Featuring ugly Christmas Sweaters, too many Christmas songs, and not enough snow.

9K, Teen and Up

you kiss him once more before pulling away, lacing your fingers together. “maybe once you get me home.”

“sounds like we need to leave early.”

you can’t help but smile again. “sounds like it.”

summary: We may never cross each others paths in life, but every time I hear this song I think of you. You are so kind, talented, and...
body: We may never cross each others paths in life, but every time I hear this song I think of you. You are so kind, talented, and intelligent I just know it and that’s what gives me hope. Love you always.
